EVAC, EVAC General
36.1 EVAC General
� General Information
36.1.1 Target / Objectives of the function
Aim ?
? To trap fuel vapors from the fuel tank, in an activated charcoal ?lter (ACF)
? To inject this fuel to the engine in phase with the engine management system.
Why ?
? To prevent the pollution of fuel vapor escaping to the environment.
? To improve fuel economy.
How ?
? By periodically purging the contents of the ACF into the intake manifold
? By controlling the opening/closing of a canister purge solenoid (CPS) located between the ACF and
intake manifold.
? By using the engine vacuum to introduce this added fuel to the combustion chamber.
The goal of EVAC aggregate is to manage the fuel vapors coming out of the charcoal canister, in
accordance with all other functions of engine management system. The fuel vapors generated in the fuel
tank are stored in a canister. By closing / opening the canister purge soleno�d, the fuel vapors are fed in
the intake manifold at throttle level.
In order to prevent lambda deviations caused by these fuel vapors, this added purge fuel is predicted and
a correction is made on fuel mass (for Pi appications and Di with homogeneous mode) or on torque (for
DI strati?ed mode).
The evaporative emissions of the fuel tank system are stored in an activated charcoal ?lter ACF to
prevent an escape of the gas to the environment. The loading capacity of the ?lter is limited, so the ?lter
must be purged temporarily. Therefore the canister purge solenoid CPS that is positioned between the
charcoal ?lter and the intake manifold is opened by the engine management system, in special by this
aggregate EVAC. To prevent driveability and emission problems, the opening of the CPS must be
controlled.
With the Evaporative Emission Control aggregate, the opening of the CPS is controlled in dependence
on the fuel mass stored in the canister. The canister load cl is calculated using the measured mass air
?ow MAF, the deviation of the lambda-control when the CPS is opened, the mass ?ow through the CPS
and the stoichiometric constant of the fuel (14.7).
36.1.2 Requirements
- -
36.1.3 Function principle
Scheme of the system used
The mixture coming from the canister is measured (MAP application) or not (MAF application).
When the canister is full, HC in manifold causes a richer A/F ratio
This in?uence has to be corrected by A/F regulation loop

Figure 36.1.1:
Physical background of the function
The evaporative emissions of the fuel tank system are stored in an activated charcoal ?lter (ACF) to prevent an
escape of the gas to the environment. The loading capacity of the ?lter is limited. So the charcoal canister must
be purged temporarily. In order to prevent downgraded fuel consumption the fuel from ACF is recirculationg
into the engine. Therefore the canister purge solenoid (CPS), that is positioned between the charcoal ?lter and
the intake manifold is controlled by the engine management system.
To prevent driveability and emission problems, the opening of the CPS and so the purge ?ow has to be con-
trolled properly.
The canister purge function has a great in?uence on engine performance :
? The exhaust emission levels obtained without canister purge activation has to provide a suf?cient
margin before reaching the legislation limits (margin of 30% on HC, CO2 and NOX).
? The lambda controller is a main input of the canister purge strategy. The purge operation is depending
on the lambda controller robustness.
? Recommended purge ratio max. 25% of total fuel.
Function boundaries
Function deactivation or closed loop deactivation may depend on various circumstances, please refer to the
application incidences.

Function description : Evaporative emission control
The evap control is composed of three main states:
? NO_PURGE operation: no purging, CPS is closed
? MIN_PURGE operation: minimum purge is applied due to unknown canister load.
? NORMAL_PURGE operation: high purge rate is applied and A/F correction is adapted to the canister
load, this state is divided in four sub-states: RAMP_OPEN, RAMP_OPEN_FAST, MAX_PURGE,
RAMP_CLOSE
and the transient states RAMP_TO_NO_PURGE, WAIT_RAMP_OPEN.

Figure 36.1.3:
NO_PURGE
During this mode, CPS valve is closed
This mode is used
? when conditions to authorize evap control are not ful?lled (TCO, ...)
? while the lambda adaptation phase is ongoing
? in case of failures (CPS valve, ...)
? in case of OBD2 diagnosis request (catalyst check...)
? in case of evaporative system monitoring active
MIN_PURGE
The MIN_PURGE or open loop operation operation is used when the charcoal canister has to be purged even
if its load cannot be learned.
The conditions are:
? Vehicle is not equipped with A/F control
? A/F regulation component failures (lambda sensor...)
? Transient driving conditions. In this case, the purge ?ow is adjusted to have a maximum of 5% A/F ratio
deviation with a saturated canister.
NORMAL_PURGE / closed loop operation
The normal operation is used when the determination of the canister load is ?nished.
Purge ?ow is adjusted to have the maximum of A/F ratio deviation with a saturated canister.

EVAC, EVAC General
The NORMAL_PURGE operation is proceeded in the following sequences:
RAMP_OPEN ?MAX_PURGE ?RAMP_CLOSE
RAMP_OPEN_FAST ?MAX_PURGE ?RAMP_CLOSE
RAMP_OPEN
At ?rst start of the NORMAL_PURGE the canister load is unknown. So, the purge valve is opened slowly using
a ramp (a high deviation of the lambda control shall be prevented). During this learning the fuel injection time
is corrected to avoid emission and driveability problems. The Canister Load is determined by the fuel purge
/ ?owpurge ratio.
The RAMP_OPEN operation is ?nished when :
? CL is learned and stable or
? The canister fuel ?ow (MFF_CP) is greater than a threshold
RAMP_OPEN_FAST
When the canister load is considered as known, indicated by beeing within a certatin time interval since last
MAX_PURGE, the closed loop operation may start with a faster learning phase / ramp. This RAMP_OPEN_FAST
operation is ?nished when :
? The purge ?ow greater than a threshold
? The canister fuel ?ow (MFF_CP) is greater than a threshold.
MAX_PURGE
During MAX_PURGE operation the CPS valve is controlled by the canister load, thus a constant fuel ratio (fuel
from cps / total fuel) is applied and the valve opening is controlled to keep this constant fuel ratio by adjusting
the total purge ?ow.
The target is to reach high ef?ciency purging. When the CL is low the purge valve opening will be increased
to ?nd the maximum limit of canister fuel ?ow.
RAMP_CLOSE
When the purge time is elapsed the purge ?ow is decreased via a ramp in RAMP_CLOSE operation.
Function description : Time scheduler
Lambda adapation and canister purge both use a lambda deviation for their purposes. Indeed, as the canister
purge itself causes a certain lambda deviation, both functions can not work simultaneous. As a consequence,
a time management has to be installed partitioning the engine opertating time and enabling either canister
purge or lambda adaptation while disabling the other function.
The engine operation is divided into 3 time ranges:
? Fixed time slices for a de?ned period after engine start.
? Dynamic lambda adaptation time period
? Dynamic canister purge active time period
At the end of a learning phas (RAMP_OPEN or RAMP_OPEN_FAST), the remaining time for MAX_PURGE is re-
evaluated with the table IP_T_MAX_CP depending on canister load. The demands of the lambda adaptation
are considered by a value T_PRI_TOT_LAM_AD delivered by lambda adaptation.

NC_RHO_0_CP:
This constant de?nes the air density at nominal conditions (NC_T_0_CP and NC_P_0_CP) and is used to calcu-

NC_T_0_CP:
This constant de?nes the nominal air temperature that is used to apply a temperature correction via TIA for
the volume of the intake manifold.

This constant de?nes the nominal air pressure that is used to apply a pressure correction via MAP for the
volume of the intake manifold.

EVAC, EVAC Con?guration data
Number of physikal intake manifolds for canister purge.
NC_NR_CYL_PURGE_CP:
Number of cylinders which are purged by one CPS valve.
NC_PSD_DLY_CPS:
Number of recurrences with diagnosis deactivation after diagnosis activation conditions are met (typical 2).
NC_FLOW_SP_MPL_CP_CONF:
Enables you to use one map for ?ow calculation or to choose between two maps depending on ENG_MODE.
NC_FLOW_LIM_NVLD_CP_CONF:
This constant decides whether a Flow limitation will be used or not.
NC_FRQ_CPPWM_MPL_CP_CONF:
Setting this constant applies multiple frequencies for CPS-Valves.
NLC_DLY_BUF_FLOW_CP_CONF:
used to activate (=1) a second buffer VOL_BUF_CP for gas delay estimation.
NLC_TQ_HOM_MOD_CP_CONF:
indicates a torque correction is applied (=1) or not (=0)
NC_CL_ECO_MPL_CP_CONF:
If set, multiple mode is possible (N, MAF_CP_IT based or TQI_SP_S_CP_IT, LAMB_SP_S based), if not set only a
single mode (N, MAF_CP_IT based) is possible. Single mode is called "eng-homogenius" and multiple mode is
called "eng-homogenius plus eng-strati?ed".
NLC_T_TBL_MPL_CP_CONF :
switch to use single (=0) or multiple (=1) table de?ned by ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_1/_2.
The time slice control begines with CP_FIXED or LAM_FIXED.

36.3.2.2.1.2.2 Detection of limited dynamic conditions for CL_MMV calculation
The detection of the limited dynamics are calculated based on the current engine speed, air mass ?ow
and combustion mode. The input to this function is the difference between each of the mentioned base
values and its moving mean values. If one of this differences exceeds a calibrated threshold, LV_INT_LDC_RST_
File: 30403H0C.00B

EVAC, Evaporative emission control variables
CP is set and a delay time based on MAF_CYL_CP_IT is initialised. Simultaneously, the CL_MMV calculation is
frozen with the bit LV_CL_MMV_LDC_SUM_DEAC_CP.
When LV_INT_LDC_RST_CP is set back to 0, the timer starts decrementing. During this period, CL_MMV remains
frozen. After that, the calculation restarts.
Notes: 1) This function can be deactivated by setting LC_CP_LDC_CLC_ENA=0.
2) the calibration parameters with maximum limitation shall not be set to zero, in order to avoid the
oscillation switch, whether the dynamic condition is detected via monitoring the difference between MAF and
N and their mean values respectively.
The Figure below shows an example for engine speed N limited dynamic. The ?lter for N_LDC_MMV_CP will
reset if the difference to N is over a limit (C_N_LDC_MAX_CP). At this event a timer is initialized(T_DLY_LDC_
MAX_PURGE_CP) and deactivates the closed loop calculation as long as it is not counted down.

36.3.2.2.2 Trailing throttle information for canister purge
In case of trailing throttle condition LV_PU, the fuel coming from the purge could be important compared to
the fuel injected. To prevent any malfunction it is necessary to close the purge valve during a delay C_T_DLY_
PU_CPS. During this time the ?ag LV_CP_PU is set to 1.

36.3.2.2.3 Canister purge prohibition after "trailing fuel cut off"
After a fuel cut off phase (PUC) the engine needs a certain time to stabilize the air fuel ratio. During this phase
the lambda controller has a deviation. To prevent that this deviation has an in?uence on the CL calculation,
canister purge will be disabled after a PUC phase.

36.3.2.2.4 Lambda control limitation reached
When the lambda control output FAC_LAM_MV_MMV_CP exceeds a minimum or maximum value (C_FAC_
LAM_MV_MMV_CP_BOL, C_FAC_LAM_MV_MMV_CP_TOL), a timer is set. As soon as the lambda control value is
again in its limits, the bit information is reset. In order to memorize this information and to wait for a lambda
control value stabilized, an information is managed LV_LAM_LIM_CP.
This value is set to TRUE as long as any lambda control limit is exceeded and reset after a delay C_T_LAM_LIM_
CP after the lambda control is within its limits again.

36.3.2.2.5 Lambda control within functional window
Parallel to the observation of lambda control limits using the ?ags LV_FAC_LAM_LIM_MIN and LV_FAC_LAM_
LIM_MAX coming from the lambda controller, the canister purge strategy provides two independent limits
C_FAC_LAM_CP_BOL & C_FAC_LAM_CP_TOL for operations of the functions being not in RAMP_OPEN (which
actually means in this case that the state machine is not in "WAIT_RAMP_OPEN").
When STATE_CP = RAMP_OPEN is active, the limits are widened to C_FAC_LAM_CP_BOL/TOL +/- C_FAC_LAM_
CP_OFS providing a higher operating band and therefore reducing the likelihood of interruptions of the learn-
ing phase.

36.3.2.2.6 Detection of and reaction on frozen-lambda-control status
If lambda controller value is frozen (signalized by LV_FAC_LAM_LIM_NOT_STAT_CDN), the canister purge func-
tion is forced to condition NO_PURGE after a delayed time in case the canister purge function is in WRO or RO.
This is accomplished by using the negation of the generated bit LV_STATE_LAM_STOP_CP as an input for the
ramp-open-conditions (See chapter ?Determination of the conditions for RAMP_OPEN? (<cdn_ramp_open>)).
If the canister purge function is in MAX_PURGE, purging is not stopped but the canister load learning will be
inhibited as long as the lambda sensor value is within calibrated limits. The canister load learning is inhibited
by using the ?ag LV_STATE_LAM_STOP_CP as an input for LV_CL_MMV_CAL_ACT.

� General Information
The purpose of this module is to easily generate an interface between EVAC core speci?c variables and their
equivalent from other aggregates like for example from INSY or LACO.
The meanings of the produced ?ag is brie?y described inside the pseudo code text below.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: on ECU reset:
LV_LAM_AD_ENA_PRI_MNG[i] = 1
on igkoff2on:
LV_CP_ACT = 0
T_AST_CP = 0
T_STATE_T_SDL_CP_LAM_AD_EXT = 0
LV_STATE_T_SDL_CP_LAM_AD_EXT = 0
Recurrence: 20 ms

EVAC, Evaporative emission control variables (Appl. Inc.)
� Function Description
MAF_CP_IT = MAF
MAF_CYL_CP_IT = MAF_CYL
MAF_THR_CP_IT = MAF_THR
MAF_KGH_FG_PRED_CP_IT = MAF_KGH_FG_PRED
MAF_SP_TQI_CP_IT = MAF_STK_SP_TQI
TQI_SP_S_CP_IT = TQI_SP_S
MAF_KGH_THR_CP = MAF_CPS + ( max(C_MAF_THR_MIN_CP, MAF_THR))
MAF_KGH_DLY_IN_CP = MAF_KGH_THR_CP
MFF_MIN_CP = C_MFF_MIN_CP
LV_LAM_AD_CDN_CP = 1
LV_LAM_AD_END_CP = LV_LAM_AD_END
LV_CP_CAT_PURGE = 0
MAP_CP_IT = MAP
T_AST_CP = T_AST_DC_CON
/* Consideration of variable intake manifold */
IF LV_VIM_SP[0] = 1 // variable intake manifold present
THEN VOL_VIM_CP = C_VOL_VIM_CP[0] //long switchover intake-system
ELSE VOL_VIM_CP = C_VOL_VIM_CP[1] //short switchover intake-system
ENDIF
/* Source selection for PRS_CPS */
IF LC_PRS_CPS_EXT = 1 //?external? pressure value source
THEN PRS_CPS = PRS_CPS_EXT //relevant for charged engine
ELSE PRS_CPS = max(AMP - MAP, AMP_DEC)
ENDIF
/* StartStop inhibition from EVAC due to too high canister load value */
If LV_INH_CP_FAST = 0 AND LV_INH_CP = 0
Then
IF CL_MMV > C_CL_MMV_MIN_STST_STOP_INH_REQ
THEN LV_STST_STOP_INH_CP = 1
ELSE
IF CL_MMV < C_CL_MMV_MAX_STST_STOP_INH_RST
THEN LV_STST_STOP_INH_CP = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF
Else LV_STST_STOP_INH_CP = 0
Endif
/* Req. engine speed setpoint increase due to too high canister load */
IF LV_IS = 1
THEN

IF ( LV_LAM_STOP[1] = 1 //if present on one of the ...
and LV_LAM_STOP_SHO_PER[1] = 0 ) // ...lambda sensors
#IF NC_USE_CBK_EX_NR = 2 // - - > second lambda sensor
or ( LV_LAM_STOP[1] = 1
and LV_LAM_STOP_SHO_PER[1] = 0 )
#ENDIF
THEN LV_LAM_STOP_CP = 1 // bit forces CP to MIN_PURGE
ELSE LV_LAM_STOP_CP = 0
ENDIF
/* Activation of the Evaporative Emission Control Function (LV_CP_ACT)*/
IF[ TCO > C_TCO_MIN_CP // min TCO exceeded
or T_AST > IP_T_ST_AST_TCO_ST_CPS_MIN(TCO_ST) ] //eng. run time
and T_AST_CP > C_T_AST_MIN_CP //timer after DC start
#IF NC_STATE_STST_CONF = 1 //system with StartStop
and ( LV_ES = 0 or LV_STST_STOP_CYC = 1) //CP not disabled in ...
and ( LV_ST = 0 or LV_STST_STOP_CYC = 1) //... case of StSt
#ELSE
and LV_ST = 0
and LV_ES = 0
#ENDIF
and LV_DIAG_SA_SYS_ACT = 0
and ( LV_AST = 0 or LC_CP_AST_ACT = 0)
and LC_CP_ACT = 1 //CP general enable switch
THEN LV_CP_ACT = 1 // generally enables canister purge (=EVAC)
ELSE LV_CP_ACT = 0
ENDIF
// To reuse the CL and CL_MMV after engine stopped or started by a
// Start-Stop system the reset of CL and CL_MMV shall be avoided by CP
// deactivation through LV_CP_ACT = 0. However EVAC shall be inhibited
// to entry NO_PURGE state, so that CL and CL_MMV will be frozen,
// therefore they can be reused in other CP states.
#IF NC_STATE_STST_CONF = 1
#THEN
IF LV_STST_STOP_CYC = 1
THEN LV_INH_CP_FAST_STST_REQ_CP = 1 //force state ?NO_PURGE?
ELSE LV_INH_CP_FAST_STST_REQ_CP = 0
ENDIF
#ENDIF

� General Information
The evaporative emissions of the fuel tank system are stored in an activated charcoal ?lter ACF to prevent an
escape of the gas to the environment. The loading capacity of the ?lter is limited, so the ?lter must be purged
temporarily. Therefore the canister purge solenoid (CPS) that is positioned between the charcoal ?lter and the
intake manifold is opened by the engine management system. To prevent drivability and emission problems
the opening of the CPS and therefore the purge ?ow MFF_CP must be controlled.
With the Evaporative Emission Control function, the opening of the CPS is controlled in dependence on the
fuel mass stored in the canister. Therefore the canister load CL is calculated using the measured mass air ?ow
MAF, the deviation of the lambda control when the CPS is opened, the mass ?ow through the CPS and the
stoichiometric constant of the fuel (14.7). The opening of the CPS is controlled in dependence with the canister
load CL.

36.7.2 Operations for the 20ms task
The 20ms task is divided into three main sections. The ?rst and second sections represent a state machine,
where the STATE_CP is calculated. The ?rst section determines the transitions between the different STATE_CP,
whereas in the second section the actions for the chosen state are done. In the last section some general
calculations are done.
36.7.2.1 STATE_CP transitions
The possible transitions are shown in the following ?gure; furthermore a transition from every state to CP_
NOT_ACT in case of a deactivation of the evaporative emission control function is possible.

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
The canister purge control has the following states:
CP_NOT_ACT Function inactive, initial state
NO_PURGE Valve closed, no purging.
MIN_PURGE Open loop purge with low ?ow
WAIT_RAMP_OPEN Waiting for lambda control stabilisation
RAMP_OPEN Slow opening of the valve, learning mode
RAMP_OPEN_FAST Faster opening of the valve; CL approximately known
MAX_PURGE Controlled canister purge with high ?ow
RAMP_CLOSE Closing of the valve at the end of controlled operation
The states RAMP_OPEN, RAMP_OPEN_FAST and MAX_PURGE are referenced as the ?normal purge? states,
where a closed loop purge with injection correction is applied.

Figure 36.7.5:
The bold transitions and states mark the nominal behaviour; the dashed bold lines show the transitions in
case of an interruption, if one of the phases is disabled for a short time and the interrupt is not longer than an
applicable time constant.
C_T_DI_RAMP_OPEN_CP_0/1 (STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP = RAMP_OPEN_DEAC) or
C_T_DI_MAX_CP_0/1 (STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP = MAX_PURGE_DEAC) or
C_T_DI_RAMP_FAST_CP_0/1 (STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP = RAMP_FAST_DEAC)
When the interruption times are longer than the corresponding constants, normal purge is re-started with a
new RAMP_OPEN / RAMP_OPEN_FAST phase. (FLOW_CTL_CPS starts with zero.)

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
36.7.2.1.3 WAIT_RAMP_OPEN
36.7.2.1.3.1 Transition conditions from WAIT_RAMP_OPEN
This state can only be accessed from NO_PURGE and is used for lambda controller stabilization before the CL
learning states RAMP_OPEN or RAMP_OPEN_FAST are accessed. The stabilization is considered if the limited
dynamics are given for a certain time, which is determined from a MAF integral.

36.7.2.2.2 NO_PURGE
During this state the CPS valve is closed and there is no purging. The timer T_DI_CP is calculated which is used
to determine whether a closed loop state can be resumed if the conditions are given again or a new learning
phase has to be applied.

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
36.7.2.2.2.1 Time counter for disabled RAMP_OPEN/_FAST or MAX_PURGE operation
In order to get more purge performance during the emission cycle, the timer shall not be set back to zero, if
the RAMP_OPEN/FAST or MAX_PURGE is interrupted. The interrupted purge state shall be resumed after ?xed
lambda adaptation by setting STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP with the leaving state. Reset on LV_CP_ENA is removed

Figure 36.7.70:
36.7.2.2.3 WAIT_RAMP_OPEN
In this state two tasks are done. First a short opening of the CPS valve with a signi?cant ?ow is applied to
remove sticking effects of the CPS valve that can be present if the valve was closed for a long time. Second a
stabilization time is applied to ensure steady lambda controller operation before the learning phase is started
and a reference lambda controller output FAC_LAM_0_CP is memorized (cf. module ?Lambda deviation and
canister load?).
36.7.2.2.3.1 Calculation of MAF integral for lambda controller stabilization
The total mass air ?ow is integrated for checking the EVAC performance related to emission standards.
It shall be mentioned, that a pre-pulse will be generated in EVAC valve control SW module (902F) to avoid
possible sticking problem during the WAIT_RAMP_OPEN. Therefore, the FLOW_TAR_CPS has been set directly
to minimal value, and will not used for avoiding sticking problem.

During MIN_PURGE operation no injection correction is done, as the lambda controller signal is considered
to be not valid. Therefore only a small purge rate is used, the corresponding ?ow target and gradient are
determined in the ?rst subchapter. The second one calculates a time counter for disabled closed loop purge
operation to determine, whether these states can be resumed if the conditions are given again.

FLOW_TAR_CPS has to be 0 until Pre-Pulse has ?nished.

36.7.2.2.4.3 Mass ?ow evacuation in purge line per driving cycle
The mass air ?ow in canister purge pipeline can in?uence the vehicle driving behavior, specially at start of a
new driving cycle after vehicle being parked longer time. Therefore the mass air ?ow in purge pipeline shall
be evacuated after engine-start once during a driving cycle.
The integral of mass air ?ow will be performed, only if the ambient air temperature is larger than a de?ned
threshold. Otherwise, LV_MAF_PIPE_PURGE_CP will be set to 0, and therefore, there is no mass ?ow evacuation
during this driving cycle

36.7.2.2.5 RAMP_OPEN and RAMP_OPEN_FAST
As the behaviour of these two states is nearly identical and there are only a few differences concerning the
behaviour in this module, both states are described together. The small differences are made with an explicit
STATE_CP distinction.
36.7.2.2.5.1 Selection between ?ow incrementation steps and waiting for gas transfer
As the canister load is unknown when the state RAMP_OPEN/_FAST is entered, no reliable injection correction
can be done. To avoid signi?cant in?uence of the exhaust emissions, the valve is opened for a small amount
and then the gas transfer time (i.e. the time that is necessary for the purge gases to reach the O2 sensor) is
awaited to be sure the effects of the opening can be observed in the lambda controller output. Afterwards the
?ow is increased by a speci?c amount and the gas transfer time is awaited again.

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
36.7.2.2.6 MAX_PURGE
During the MAX_PURGE operation, the maximum purge rate is applied. The ?rst subchapter determines the
?ag LV_T_DLY_REQ_CP, whereas the second chapter calculates the ?ow target and gradient. In the last sub-
chapter the CL_MMV value is stored for the OBDII EVAP system monitoring.
36.7.2.2.6.1 Calculation of LV_T_DLY_REQ_CP
This management is useful essentially during an emission cycle. The aim is to stop the purge in case of request
from the catalyst diagnosis (or another OBD2 diagnosis), one time during the cycle.
LV_T_DLY_REQ_CP is set C_T_DLY_REQ_CP seconds after a RAMP_OPEN and stay to 1 until next trip or engine
stalling.
The ?ag is set after having been for a time C_T_DLY_REQ_CP in an un-interrupted MAX_PURGE coming from
RAMP_OPEN and stay to 1 until next trip or engine stalling.
When coming from any other state than RAMP_OPEN, the ?ag is not calculated.

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
36.7.2.2.7 RAMP_CLOSE
This state is entered if a closing of the valve is necessary but a ramp can be applied (no immediate closing
necessary). In contrast to the former usage of this state it is no closed loop state anymore, i.e. no CL calculation
is performed during this state. Depending on the predecessor state, injection correction is done or not. If
the predecessor state was a closed loop state, the LV_STATE_MEM_CP_CLL is true and therefore an injection
correction based on the last calculated CL_MMV_ is done, when MIN_PURGE was left this ?ag is zero and
therefore no injection correction will be done.
As the ?ow target is most obviously 0, only the ?ow gradient as well as the timers for disabled closed loop
purge are calculated.

EVAC, Evaporative emission control
36.7.3.1 Pade- and low-pass ?lter calculations
In the 100ms task the delayed values of MAF_CP and FLOW_CPS are calculated. The as there is a manifold
mass air ?ow and pressure depending time delay from purge gases passing the CPS valve to the observable
impacts on the air/fuel ratio at the O2 sensor, these values are needed amongst other things for the canister
load calculation. As the delay time is not constant, a Pade-approximation of the dead time transfer function
is used. The values are afterwards ?ltered with a ?rst-order low-pass to describe mixture effects in the intake
manifold and combustion chamber.

� General Information
Within this application incidences speci?cation for Evaporative emission control the following things are de-
?ned:
1. Calculation of inputs for the basic EVAC control speci?cation that differ from project to project like PRS_
CPS_EXT, LV_PRS_CPS_MIN_PURGE, etc.
2. De?nition of conditions for canister purge inhibition during crank case ventilation (LV_INH_CP_CRCV)
3. De?nition of MIN_PURGE ?enforcement? bit LV_INH_CP_CLL due to system errors
4. De?nition of NO_PURGE ?enforcement? bit LV_INH_CP due to e.g. CAT-Diag, DLY-Diag, TAM too low, etc.
5. De?nition of ?NO_FAST? (leading then to NO_PURGE without RAMP_CLOSE) ?enforcement? bit LV_INH_CP_
FAST due to EVAM intervention, DYN-DIag. of LACO, etc.
6. PRS_CPS increase function due to too high canister load under certain conditions
7. Calculation (at 20 ms grid) of injection related and crankcase ventilation related variables like MFF_SP_CP,
MFF_SP_MV_KGH_CP, LV_REQ_CP_CRCV_DI, etc.
8. Flow factor calculation due high ?ow difference with the characteristic by using the reduced area con-
troller.

36.8.2.5 Activation conditions to increase PRS_CPS and function structure
An active increase of the PRS_CPS (so the pressure difference between intake manifold and ambient) might be
necessary, in case the canister load is too high and there is no physical possibility to increase the purge ?ow
with the current engine parameters. PRS_CPS is hereby increased indirectly by increasing the engine speed
or compressor parameters. This engine speed increase is only possible on vehicles that are equipped with
automatic gearboxes.
The activation condition for the PRS_CPS increase are as follows:
- Canister purge generally running
- AMP smaller than a threshold
- TAM higher than a threshold
- Canister purge not disabled by EVAM, CAT-Diag, etc. (LV_INH_CP, LV_INH_CP_FAST)
- Engine speed set point increase from last function activation decreased down to zero
The ?ltering of the canister load, CL_MMV_FIL, is always calculated in order to have a ?ltered canister load
value ready as soon as the actual calculation for the PRS_CPS increase function starts.

requested engine speed set point increase is ramped down to zero and the general request ?ag to increase
the PRS_CPS is also reset. All other variables keep their last value.

36.8.2.5.1 Filtering of the canister load mean value (CL_MMV_FIL)
The calculation of the canister load ?ltering takes place independently from the enabling of the PRS_CPS
increase functionality.
The ?ltered canister load value is calculated when LV_CL_MMV_CAL_ACT is set. When this ?ag goes to zero,
CL_MMV_FIL is frozen.
The ?lter factor calculation takes into account the current CL_MMV value and the current CL_MMV_FIL value
difference. The ?lter factor itself is determined by the map IP_CRLC_CL_MMV_FIL. The higher the difference
between the two canister load values, the faster the ?ltering can happen.

36.8.2.5.2 Calculation of conditions to increase PRS_CPS
The functionality to increase the PRS_CPS is structured in four calculation blocks.
The calculation order is the same like the listing order below.
In the blocks, the following things are calculated:
a) T_MAX_PRS_INC_CTL: In this block a general ?observation? timer counts-up. Within this de?ned time window,
certain conditions b) and c) are monitored and checked when elapsed.
b) NO_PURGE_CDN: As long as the general timer has not elapsed (LV_T_MAX_PRS_INC_END = 0), an addi-
tional NO_PURGE timer counts up if STATE_CP is in NO_PURGE or in WAIT_RAMP_OPEN. That means, the
timer counts-up as long as no purging takes place.
As soon as the NO_PURGE-timer has exceeded a certain calibration threshold, and the general timer has
elapsed, a PRS_CPS increase request bit is set, LV_PRS_INC_CPS_NO_PURGE = 1.
c) FLOW_TOT_CDN: The ?ow through the canister purge line is summed-up as long as the general timer has
not elapsed (FLOW_CPS_INT_PRS_INC_CP++). When the general timer has elapsed and the integrated ?ow is
below a calibration threshold, the second request bit to increase the PRS_CPS is set, LV_FLOW_CPS_INT_PRS_
INC_CDN = 1. (one recurrence later (feedback) the ?ow integral is reset).
So in the end, there are two conditions for requesting a PRS_CPS or engine speed increase: Measured time
in which state machine STATE_CP is in no purge phase exceeds threshold or measured ?ow through canister
purge line does not exceed certain calibration threshold when general observation timer has elapsed.
d) PRS_CPS_INC_CP: Setting of ?nal request bit to increase the PRS_CPS and setting of the ?nal engine speed
set point to which the current engine speed should be increased.

36.8.2.5.2.4 Coordination of Requests to increase PRS_CPS
The request to increase the PRS_CPS are coordinated in this section.
If canister load is too high or if not enough purge has been determined, then an increase of canister purge
?ow capability is requested. This request is ?nally set, when the canister load is above a calibration threshold.
It is reset, when the canister load gets below a calibration threshold.
The request path to increase the engine speed set point can be selected with CLF_PRS_CPS_INC_CDN.

36.8.2.5.2.4.1 Calculation of engine speed set point due to PRS_CPS increase request
The way the engine speed increase is accomplished (to subsequently increase the PRS_CPS) is shown in the
signal ?ow diagram below.
If the request bit for engine speed increase is set and the MAP_SP and PRS_CPS value are within max and
minimum limits, the engine speed increase values from the table IP_N_PRS_CPS_INC_CP are used as increment
steps to increase the engine speed set point. While the increase takes place, the single steps are limited to
C_N_PRS_CPS_INC_MAX_CP.
If the conditions get lost, the engine speed set point increase is decremented with C_N_PRS_CPS_DEC_CP.
The maximum engine speed set point increase possible at a certain VS and PQ_THR_SP state, is limited by the
table IP_N_PRS_CPS_LIM_CP. If the limit is reached, the ?activation? condition for the increase gets lost and the
engine speed request set point is decremented.

36.8.3.1.2 Calculation of inhibition of canister purge (ramp transition to NO_PURGE)
In case the bit LV_INH_CP is set. a transition to NO_PURGE of STATE_CP (no purge operation) will be the con-
sequence.
With the con?guration of byte C_CONF_INH_CP and C_CONF_INH_2_CP is the possibility to select conditions to
set LV_INH_CP.
The meaning of the con?guration bytes is as follow:
C_CONF_INH_CP bit0 = enables the CP inhibition in case of idle speed and inactive air conditioning compres-
sor,
C_CONF_INH_CP bit1 = enables the CP inhibition in case of TLDP request.
C_CONF_INH_CP bit2 = enables the CP inhibition in case of O2 sensor delay diagnosis with ramp transition to
NO_PURGE
C_CONF_INH_CP bit3 = enables the CP inhibition in case of O2 sensor dynamic diagnosis with ramp transition
to NO_PURGE.
C_CONF_INH_CP bit6 = enables the CP inhibition in case of Crankcase Ventilation too high with ramp transition
to NO_PURGE.
C_CONF_INH_CP bit7 = enable the CP inhibition in case of Flex Fuel controller being not activated, namely not
at state "FINISHED" or "WAIT". LV_FAC_AFU_CP_DEAC is the ?ag indicating that canister purge is forbidden.
C_CONF_INH_2_CP bit0 = enables the CP inhibition in case of low MAF.
C_CONF_INH_2_CP bit1 = enables the CP inhibition in case of ongoing CAT or DYN diagnosis or cylinder bal-
ancing

36.8.3.1.3 Calculation of inhibition of canister purge (fast transition to NO_PURGE)
In case the bit LV_INH_CP_FAST is set, STATE_CP is set to NO_PURGE with STATE_CDN_CP being at ?CDN_NO_
FAST?.
LV_DIAGCPS_ACT_DIAGCPS sets the request for CPS-Check and therefore needs immediate stop of purging.
With the con?guration byte C_CONF_INH_CP there is the possibility to select conditions to set LV_INH_CP_
FAST.
The meaning of the con?guration bytes is as follow:
C_CONF_INH_CP bit4 = enables the CP inhibition in case of O2 sensor delay diagnosis with fast transition to
NO_PURGE
C_CONF_INH_CP bit5 = enables the CP inhibition in case of O2 sensor dynamic diagnosis with fast transition to
NO_PURGE.
If Start-Stop system is activated, in order to reuse CL and CL_MMV, EVAC shall entry the NO_PURGE state by a
inhibition CP request LV_INH_CP_FAST_STST_REQ_CP.
C_CONF_INH_2_CP bit2 = enables the CP inhibition in case of ongoing CAT or DYN diagnosis or cylinder bal-
ancing.

36.8.3.2.2 Canister purge ?ow external correction
The canister purge ?ow set point FLOW_COR_CPS will be corrected in case of high ?ow difference with the
standard characteristic. This will be done with help of Intake manifold reduced area controller.
When the valve is open and when the correction activation condition are ful?lled LV_AR_RED_CP_ACT, the
reduced area controller value is memorized as a reference. Only the difference with this reference value will be
used to correct the canister purge ?ow.

Switch to choose gas delay calculation method (0 = via IP_MFF_DLY_CP, 1 = calculate from MAF and MAP)
LC_FLOW_CPS_CAL V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Choice of recurence for MFF_ADD_LAM_CP calculation
� General Information
When the Evaporative Emission Control is active, the fuel injection is corrected by an additive value MFF_ADD_
CP_INTER to avoid emission and drivability problems caused by the fuel ?ow through the CPS. This correction
is done all the time.
During RAMP_OPEN when the lambda control is shifted the buffer will be initialized to the last MFF_ADD_CP_
KGH value.
The MFF_BUF_CP value is calculated to take into account the distance between the CPS VALVE and the injec-
tors.
The value MFF_ADD_CP_INTER is synchronized with lambda controller shifts within the LACO aggregate and
as MFF_ADD_CP_EX_CBK_SPC added with a minus sign to the total formula of the injection calculation (see
chapter INJECTION).
The value MFF_TOT_CP allows measuring the quantity of fuel during an emission cycle.
After the initialization phase the buffer must be calculated all the time, in order to have the buffer empty when
the evaporative function is stopped.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, IGKON
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 20MS

weighting of the canister fuel mass with the tachometric factors of the injected fuel and the purged fuel.

36.9.2.1.1.3 Handling of the ringbuffer
The buffer MFF_ADD_BUF has NC_NR_CP_BUF elements.
IDX_CP, IDX_RD_CP and IDX_STEP_CP are pointers within the ring buffer; they have to be checked for exceeding
the limits of the ring buffer.
IDX_CP is the current position within the ring buffer MFF_ADD_BUF. This position is incremented every 20
respectively 40 ms depending on LC_FLOW_CPS_CAL.
36.9.2.1.1.3.1 Determination of the reading position
To determine the reading position from MFF_BUF_CP, between two possibilities can be switched. The ?rst
possibility (LC_DLY_GAS_CLC_VER_CP = 0) uses the map IP_MFF_DLY_CP which determines the gas delay time
(buffer elements) depending on the actual MAF and MAP (nBufferElements = TGasDelay / TRecurrence).
The second possibility (LC_DLY_GAS_CLC_VER_CP = 1) calculates the delay time from the current volume ?ow,
corrected by MAF and MAP, using a second buffer VOL_BUF_CP.

36.9.2.1.1.4.2 Torque correction
During strati?ed combustion, the impact of the premixed fuel ?ow coming from the CPS has to be compen-
sated in an alternative way. It was demonstrated that the torque increase due to canister purge is dependent
on the mass fuel ?ow from the CPS, the engine speed, and, additionally, on the mass ?ow of fuel that originates
from the injector. The corrective torque term TQI_ADD_CP can be modelled as a function of the parameters
MFF_BUF_CP, N_32 and TQI_SP_S_CP_IT. This torque correction can then be utilized for an adjustment of the
torque setpoint in strati?ed mode.
FAC_TQI_CP is a decimal factor which permits to convert a fuel mass in a torque. Because of the different
resolutions of TQI_ADD_CP and MFF_CPS, the conversion (1389 mg/tdc / 1024 Nm) has to be taken into account
by the calibration of FAC_TQI_CP. That means, if you want MFF_CPS = TQI_ADD_CP, then you have to calibrate
FAC_TQI_CP to 0.73 (1024/1389) and not to 1.

jection correction must be stopped to decrease the CPU load. If LV_N_MAX_CP is active then the normal
calculations of the following variables are not done and the values of these variables are set to 0 and all other
values are kept.

EVAC, EVAC lambda deviation and canister load
ACTION_EVAC_ExitMaxPurge() Mode: O
This action is called to perform initializations when leaving MAX_PURGE.
ACTION_EVAC_IniAct() Mode: O
Initialisation on transition from STATE_CP=CP_NOT_ACT
ACTION_EVAC_IniNormalPurge() Mode: O
This action calls the initializations on entering normal purge
� General Information
This module calculates the lambda deviation caused by the opening of the CPS valve and a canister load value
using the lambda deviation value. The canister load is the concentration of fuel vapours within the mixture
?ow coming from the ACF.
The opening period CPPWM of the CPS is controlled in dependence of the canister load CL.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, IGKON, IGKOFF, NVMRES, NVMINI, NVMSTO, Deactivation
Activation: 20MS: LV_CP_ACT == 1
100MS: LV_CP_ACT == 1
Deactivation: LV_CP_ACT == 0
Recurrence: 20MS, 100MS

EVAC, EVAC lambda deviation and canister load
36.10.2.4.1.1 Calculation of the lambda controller difference caused by canister purge
The deviation in the lambda controller output caused by canister purge is calculated as the difference between
the reference value FAC_LAM_0_CP which is memorized at the beginning of RAMP_OPEN/_FAST and a derived
from the actual lambda deviation (i.e. the ratio between lambda set point and measured lambda value).
The part of lambda control shift isremoved, because only continuous correction is available from EVAC 10.0.0
or higher version.
The calibration array is added to provide the probability to avoid a small FAC_LAM_DIF_CP deviation affect-
ing to CL calculation. If you dose not want to use the characteristic array to affect CL calculation, you can
simply calibrate it with the same values of inputs.

36.10.2.4.1.4 Calculation of VVL throttled mode request
This function determines, whether the purge rate in non-throttled VVL operation mode is suf?cient or a switch
to throttled operation mode should be requested. Then the ?ag LV_VVL_THR_MOD_REQ_CP is set. This func-
tionality can be switched of with the logical calibration value LC_VVL_THR_MOD_REQ_CP.
Throttled mode is requested if the canister load CL_MMV is greater then the threshold C_CL_MMV_ VVL_REQ_
TOL. The bit information is reset if the canister load falls below the threshold C_CL_MMV_ VVL_REQ_BOL.

36.10.3.2 Conditions for canister load calculation
This calculation is called in RAMP_OPEN, RAMP_OPEN_FAST, MAX_PURGE and RAMP_CLOSE.
The load CL of the ACF is calculated as the ratio of the fuel ?ow MFF_LAM_CP and the ?ow FLOW_DLY_MMV_
CP added to the ratio of the fuel ?ow MFF_ADD_CP_KGH and the ?ow FLOW_CPS.
The ?ow FLOW_DLY_MMV_CP is the ?ltered value of FLOW_CPS using a Pade-?lter and a moving mean value
calculation to consider the delay between the FLOW_CPS and the MFF_LAM_CP calculation. Those calculations
are described in a separate chapter.
The minimum and maximum values of this ratio are limited by 0 and C_CL_MAX_CP. The value of CL is ?ltered
using a moving mean value calculation. The value of CL is only calculated when the engine is operated at
limited dynamics (LV_CP_DYW=1).
The calculation of ?lter parameter FAC_LAM_GRD_MMV is performed in 100ms task continually to get a stable
value.
If a limited dynamic condition is detected, closed loop calculation will be frozen under state of MAX_PURGE.
If a frozen lambda controller is detected, closed loop calculation will be frozen in MAX_PURGE.

CL and CL_MMV which can be caused by a too severe ?ltering of CL_MMV. To decrease the difference, the
correlation factor for CL_MMV ?ltering is set to the high initial value CRLC_CL_TMP_INI.

Figure 36.10.29:
36.10.3.2.1.4 Calculation of CL_MMV and detection of stable value
By ?ltering the CL value with the correlation factor CRLC_CL determined above, the CL_MMV value is calcu-
lated. If at least one lambda controller shift caused by canister purge is available (which means that there is
some canister load) and the CL_MMV value exceeds a minimum or maximum threshold, the timer T_RAMP_
OPEN_STAB is initialized. If the timer reaches 0 this means that there was no big change in the CL_MMV value
and there it is reliable (or the canister is empty as within the initial time C_T_DLY_MAX_RAMP_OPEN.no lambda
controller shift request was done) Then a transition from RAMP_OPEN to MAX_PURGE is done.

36.10.3.2.1.5 Ramp down of FAC_LAM_0_CP
Since we have in actual projects only one RAMP_OPEN phase during emission cycle,
FAC_LAM_0_CP can be used in RAMP_OPEN as constant start value to calculate FAC_LAM_DIF_CP and in MAX_
PURGE it will ramp down/up to 0. At end of MAX_PURGE phase it will be set to 0.
Take care:If your project will ?x FAC_LAM_0_CP to a value different to zero, with the limits C_FAC_LAM_0_MAX/
MIN, ramping should be deactivated (C_FAC_LAM_0_GRD_CP = 0)!

� General Information
This module allows project speci?c calculations for thresholds of FAC_LAM_0_CP and conditions for NEW_
RAMP_OPEN phase.
After each lambda adaption phase in interrupted MAX_PURGE phase, it is checked if the new lambda adaption
value is between a de?ned limit (C_FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP_MIN/MAX). If this value exceeds this limits a new
RAMP_OPEN phase will be executed. In the dynamic time control mode always after lambda adaption a new
RAMP_OPEN phase is initialized.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset and IGK = 0 -> 1
FAC_LAM_0_MIN = C_FAC_LAM_0_MIN
FAC_LAM_0_MAX = C_FAC_LAM_0_MAX
LV_CP_NEW_RAMP_OPEN_FAST = 0
LV_CP_NEW_RAMP_OPEN = 0
LV_INH_CL_CAL_CUS = 0
FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP = 0
LV_FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP_TMP = 0
at IGK = 0 -> 1
FAC_LAM_AD_PRE_DC_CP = SUM (FAC_LMMF_ADD_FAC_LAM_AD[i]) / NC_
CBK_EX_NR
Activation: - -
Deactivation: - -
Recurrence: 20 ms
� Function Description
if1LV_LAM_AD_ENA 1 -> 0 // if lambda adaptation end
then1 // calculate FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP
FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP = SUM (FAC_MFF_ADD_FAC_LAM_AD[i]) /
NC_CBK_EX_NR - FAC_LAM_AD_PRE_DC_CP
//Mean value of lambda adapted value
if2 { [(FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP) < C_FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP_MIN)
and (STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP = MAX_PURGE_DEAC)]
or
[(FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP) > C_FAC_LAM_AD_DIF_CP_MAX)
and (STATE_CLL_DEAC_CP = MAX_PURGE_DEAC)]
or (STATE_T_SDL_CP == CP_DYN) // always in dynamic mode

EVAC, Time control between evaporative system and lambda adaptation
ACTION_EVAC_CalcTimeSlices() Mode: O
Calculation of the time slices for canister purge and lambda adaptation
� General Information
Lambda adaptation and canister purge both use a lambda deviation for their purposes. Indeed, as the canister
purge itself causes a certain lambda deviation, both functions can not work simultaneous. As a consequence,
a time management has to be installed partitioning the engine operating time and enabling either canister
purge or lambda adaptation while disabling the other function.
Signal ?ow diagram:
Figure 36.13.1:
Figure 1: time scheduler state diagram
The state diagram above only contains the recent transitions; all possible transitions are listed in the formula
section below.
The following table indicates whether canister purge or lambda adaptation is enabled / disabled depending
on the state STATE_T_SDL_CP of the time scheduler.

Figure 36.13.2:
Figure 2: enabling of canister purge or lambda adaptation depending on state
In general the time control is split into two main parts:
At leaving start the time split between lambda adaptation and canister purge is de?ned by a certain number
of ?xed time frames. .The amount of this number is given by input signal "NC_NR_TBL_IDX_AST_CP_1" ( NC_NR_
TBL_IDX_AST_CP_1 -1 de?nes the start of dynamic time slices ).
After performing the ?xed time frames, the time periods of canister purge and lambda adaptation are depend-
ing on canister load and the necessity of lambda adaptation, indicated by their corresponding functions, so
dynamic time frames will be applied.
For Hybrid and Stop/Start con?gurations the timers for the dynamic time slices are stopped during engine off
time.
After the start phase has ended and canister purge is possible (LV_CP_ACT = 1), the manager starts with ?xed
slices de?ned in ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x. By choosing "ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x=1" the STATE_T_SDL_CP
is forced to be "CP_FIXED" and by choosing "ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x=2" the STATE_T_SDL_CP is forced to be
"LAM_FIXED" at the begining of the ?xed time slices period.
During CP_FIXED period the canister purge is possible if the conditions for the function are ful?lled. If they re
not ful?lled, neither canister purge nor lambda adaptation will be active.
During LAM_FIXED period the canister purge is disabled and the lambda adaptation is enabled. During this
period and after the canister purge valve is closed, the lambda adaptation is possible if the conditions for the
function are ful?lled. If they re not ful?lled, neither canister purge nor lambda adaptation will be active.
If the lambda adaptation sends its ready bit LV_LAM_AD_END, the lambda adaptation time will immediately
end and the state switches to CP_FIXED.

EVAC, Time control between evaporative system and lambda adaptation
This sequence (canister purge / lambda adaptation) is repeated until ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x de?nes dy-
namic slices; for each period, the start time is de?ned by the corresponding value of the indexation table
ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x.
The dynamic time frames start with WAIT_CP after the ?xed time frames are elapsed; see description of the
different states below.
Description of the different time control states
PASSIVE:
After each reset or engine stalling the time control starts with state PASSIVE and switches to CP_FIXED or
LAM_FIXED (depending on the settings in map ID_T_SET_T_AST_LAM_CP_x) when canister purge starts to be
active, i.e. LV_CP_ACT = 1 is ful?lled. Lambda adaptation can be activated during this state (con?gurable)
CP_FIXED:
Only canister purge is enabled. This state is active as long as no lambda adaptation is triggered by the corre-
sponding time threshold. If a lambda adaptation is urgently requested, LAM_FIXED is selected.
LAM_FIXED:
Only lambda adaptation is enabled. This state is left, if the adaptation is ?nished or the next ?xed or dynamic
slice starts. If immediate lambda adaptation is requested via the ?ags LV_LAM_LIM_LAM_AD[i], this state is not
left until these ?ags have been reset. Afterwards, the ?xed time slices are resumed.
CP_DYN:
Canister purge is enabled. This state is left, if the time counter T_CP elapses or an urgent lambda adaptation is
requested.
LAM_DYN:
Lambda adaptation is enabled. To leave this state, a time counter initialised when detecting an empty canister
has to have elapsed. The state is left, if the standard adaptation time counter has elapsed and no adaptation is
currently ongoing or if the end of an adaptation cycle is signalled by lambda adaptation itself.
WAIT_LAM:
Within WAIT_LAM, canister purge is enabled; this enabling may expire after an adjustable time. As soon as the
conditions for a lambda adaptation are given, this state is left towards LAM_DYN and lambda adaptation starts.
If the time counter for lambda adaptation C_T_MFF_AD_MAX is elapsed, WAIT_CP is selected and canister purge
is enabled.
WAIT_CP:
Within WAIT_CP, lambda adaptation is enabled. As soon as canister purge function is active (LV_CP_ACT = 1),
this state is left towards CP_DYN and canister purge is enabled.
EXT_REQ:

EVAC, Time control between evaporative system and lambda adaptation
If functions other than canister purge and lambda adaptation request a certain time slice with both, lambda
adaptation and canister purge deactivated, the time scheduler may switch to the state EXT_REQ for an ad-
justable time.
In all states with enabled lambda adaptation, the enabling starts when the canister purge valve is closed (LV_
CP_CLOSE_ACT = 1).
At the regular entry of MAX_PURGE (i.e. not a re-entry after a short deactivation but an entry after ?nishing
canister load learning phases RAMP_OPEN or RAMP_OPEN_FAST) the time slices for CP and lambda adap-
tation are re-evaluated; remaining time for canister purge is the minimum of IP_T_MAX_CP (depending on
canister load) and the lambda adaptation prioritisation time T_PRI_TOT_LAM_AD. A small time T_PRI_TOT_LAM_
AD from lambda adaptation is related to a high priority for lambda adaptation as the canister purge time will
be decreased.
Three cases are handled:
High canister load
If the canister is detected full at the end of the learning phase the time control gives priority to the evaporative
emission control by increasing the remaining purge time in order to decrease the canister load. The purge
time IP_T_MAX_CP is used to purge the canister.

Medium canister load
If the canister is detected with a medium load, the purge time is calculated as the minimum value between
the needs of the lambda adaptation and canister purge using the lambda adaptation prioritisation time T_PRI_
TOT_LAM_AD. A small time T_PRI_TOT_LAM_AD from lambda adaptation is related to a high priority for lambda
adaptation as the canister purge time will be decreased.

� General Information
The EVAC valve control module includes the following functionalities:
1. Pre-pulse generation to unstick the canister purge valves before its ?rst use on the DC.
2. a) An intermediate canister purge valve duty cycle output (CPPWM_H) calculation taking into account
different external requests and conditions (?special mode?).
b) An intermediate duty cycle output (CPPWM_H) calculation in normal mode with regard to ?ow re-
quest through canister purge line, pressure difference in purge line and battery voltage.
c) The canister purge valve actuation frequency output (FRQ_REQ_CP) calculation.

36.14.2 Canister purge valve control 20ms task
36.14.2.1 CPS pre pulse activation during MIN_PURGE
During STATE_CP = ?RAMP_OPEN?, the canister purge valve is slowly opened beginning from very low CPPWM_
CPS [%] values. Depending on the adhesive force that holds back the canister purge valve in the valve seat,
the PWM value from which on the CPS valve opens, can vary from driving cycle to driving cycle.
The pre-pulse functionality, so the short-term-wide opening of the CPS valve, is introduced to solve this valve
sticking problem.
To avoid critical interferences with other engine parameters, the pre-pulses are performed before the begin-
ning of the actual purge phase during STATE_CP = ?MIN_PURGE?. The general enabling of the pre-pulses is
signalized with LV_PRE_PLS_CPS_ENA = 1. Pre-pulses are done once per driving cycle.
The following picture shows a typical pre-pulse test phase with three test pulses where the ?rst test pulse is
interrupted but then continued by 3 valid CPS pre-pulses.

Figure 36.14.5:
Additional explanations for the picutre, and the pre-pulse functionality itself, are given below:
? The pre-pulse test phase is enabled (LV_PRE_PLS_CPS_ENA = 1) as soon as STATE_CP = ?MIN_PURGE? and
as long as long as the pre-pulse test phase is not yet ?nished (LV_STATE_PRE_PLS_CPS_END = 0).
? When the pre-pulse is enabled, the function immediately sets a request ?Activate Trigger?to the BSW
(basic software) (via ACTION_INFR_ENA_CPS_TRIG;not shown in picture) to get the information when the
last period of the PWM-cycle of the CPS has ended. The end of the period is signalized by LV_CPS_PWM_
PER_END = 1, which is generated from the ?End Period Trigger?(=TRIG_INFR_EndOfPWMPeriodCPS_Sig;
not shown in picture).
This is done, to align the basic software with this EVAC valve control 20ms task before the beginning of
the actual pre-pulse test.
? As soon as the ?ag LV_CPS_PWM_PER_END is set to 1, the pre-pulse test phase is activated (LV_PWM_
PRE_PLS_ACT = 1) and a PWM [%] value for the opening of the CPS is generated (CPPWM_H from C_
CPPWM_PRE_PLS_CP).
? When again the end-of-period signal is received (by BSW input trigger), which means LV_CPS_PWM_PER_
END = 1, a counter is this time increased to record the pre-pulse events and to be able to limit them to a
certain calibration number (C_CTR_PRE_PLS_CP).
? If the maximum calibration number of events is reached, the test is ?nished for this Driving Cycle (LV_
STATE_PRE_PLS_CPS_END = 1).
? If the test gets interrupted (see ?ash with ?interruption?) the pre-pulse test starts from scratch.
?

EVAC, Canister purge valve control
36.14.2.2 Canister purge valve set point determination
The normal canister purge valve control can be bypassed in case of external requests like scan tool or other
functionalities.
The functionalities that can bypass normal canister purge valve control are as follows:
- External request from scan tool (LV_CPPWM_CUS_ADJ_ENA)
- Engine speed limitation (LV_N_MAX_CP)
- Canister purge valve opening adaptation (LV_CPS_AD_ACT)
- EVAM request for CPS check or tank leak diagnosis. (LV_DIAGCP_CPPWM_CTL)
- Canister purge valve pre-pulse (LV_PRE_PLS_CPS_ENA)

During normal purge operation the valve can be actuated with 2 different frequencies. This can be con?gured
depending on project. The valve PWM setpoint CPPWM_H, the frequency FRQ_REQ_CP and the corresponding
limits values are de?ned here.
For a better understanding of the thresholds for a system with 2 possible frequencies the following picture is

Depending on the engine speed and the PWM[%] value of CPPWM_CPS, the two frequencies can be selected
by calibration of the labels displayed in the picture.
The purpose of the hysteresis is to avoid a toggling of the applied frequency.
The possibility to select between frequencies for the CPS is generally activated when the con?guration switch
NC_FRQ_CPPWM_MPL_CP_CONF is set to 1. In case it is zero, only frequency 1 is active.
If the ?ag LV_FRQ_1_CPS = 1, then only the functional parts of FRQ_1_CPS_CTL are calculated.
If the ?ag LV_FRQ_1_CPS = 0, then only the functional parts of FRQ_2_CPS_CTL are calculated.
The functional part CPPWM_BAS_CLC is calculated in both cases.

36.14.2.2.6.2.3 CPPWM correction at frequency 1
The valve opening is corrected to compensate the deviation CPS-valve lift force when the battery voltage is
different of the reference battery. This correction is made of an offset and a factor.
- The factor correction depending on VB is done (IP_CPPWM_VB_FAC_1).
- The offset correction is made of IP_CPPWM_VB_ADD_1 and IP_CPPWM_VB_FAC_PRS_CPS_1. The PWM[%] cor-
rection value is de?ned depending on the battery voltage value, multiplied by a PRS_CPS dependant correction
factor.
The maximum and the minimum PWM value are de?ned to ensure good electrical diagnosis.

36.14.2.2.6.2.4 CPPWM correction at frequency 2
As for frequency 1 the CPPWM_BAS_H is corrected to take into account the battery voltage effect. Additionally
to that a correction on CPPWM_BAS_H is applied to compensate the ?ow differences that exist between fre-
quency 1 and frequency 2. This correction IP_CPPWM_COR_FRQ is used to compensate the ?ow decrease due
to the response time of the canister purge when the frequency is increased.
This map is the only difference of CPPWM correction at frequency 2 compared to the CPPWM correction
at frequency 1.

Figure 36.14.23:
36.14.2.3 CPPWM limitation and CPS valve closed determination
One of the things realized within this sub-chapter is the limitation of CPPWM_H. This PWM duty cycle limitation
can be used to make proper electrical short circuit detection.
Additionally the canister purge PWM limitation delivers a valve closed bit (LV_CP_CLOSE_ACT = 1) when the
PWM value applied is smaller than C_CPPWM_MIN_FRQ_1_LIM_CP.
Moreover, there is the possibility to apply a manual correction to the valve actuation by setting LC_CPPWM_AS
to 1.
The actuation of the valve can be disabled in case of failures entry. The ACTION_FARM_GetPermission() is
called cyclically (20ms) in order to check the permission for provision of the calculated CPPWM value. If
any electronic failure like short of circuit to plus or ground or open circuit occurs, a substitute value will be
supplied for safety control of the CPS valve.
The FID_CPPWM_CTL_CPS_1/2 could be con?gured shown as in following table:
FID_CPPWM_CTL_CPS_1 FID_CPPWM_CTL_CPS_2
ERR_EL_CPS_SCG ERR
ERR_EL_CPS_OC ERR
ERR_EL_CPS_SCP ERR
For example, if ACTION_FARM_GetPermission()=1, the CPMWM will be provided. Otherwise EVAC provides
a substitute value.

Figure 36.14.24:
36.14.2.4 Calls to infrastructure
The PWM duty cycle and frequency are updated every 20 ms.
The physical range for the frequency request FRQ_REQ_CP is from 5 to 32 Hz.
The PWM duty cycle is provided to the BSW via ACTION_INFR_SetPWMDucyCPS and the frequency via AC-
TION_INFR_SetPWMFrqCPS.
For CPS pre-pulse functionality:
the callback function for CPS_PWM-end-of-period is enabled via ACTION_INFR_EnaCPSTrig. The response from
BSW, the CPS_PWM-end-of-period event, is delivered with TRIG_INFR_EndOfPWMPeriodCPS_Sig trigger.
It is also possible to force d the synchronization of the PWM output. In that case the PWM duty cycle and
frequency can be immediately updated, via ACTION_INFR_SetPWMDucyCPSInst at a transition from any state
(of STATE_CP) to state NO_PURGE. An additional pre-condition for the enforcement is the setting of the switch
LC_PWM_SET_INST_CP to 1.

36.14.3 CPS_PWM end of period event recognition
Every time TRIG_INFR_EndOfPWMPeriodCPS_Sig is triggered the CPS_PWM end of period event is recognized
by setting LV_CPS_PWM_PER_END.
LV_CPS_PWM_PER_END will be reset at next PRE_PULSE_CLC execution.

� General Information
This Appl. Inc. function provides condition (LV_INH_ERR_EL_CPS), which determines whether canister purge
valve shall be inhibited, by running the electronic canister purge valve diagnostic. FARM Aggregate man-
ages this electronic diagnostic function performed on ATIC113 chip. But the condition, whether this diagnostic
function shall be performed, will be determined by this function. If an another ATIC chip is applied, or the
ATIC chip is not powered by main power supplier (LV_RLY_MAIN) in the project speci?c system, the related
adaptation shall be required.

EVAC, Evaporative system control (gen)
36.20 Evaporative system control (gen)
� General Information:
Detailed description of EVAC calibration date.
The function EVAC (Evaporation emission control) ensures that the hole HC gas stored in the active charcoal
?lter (AKF) is purged thru the CPS (canister purge solenoid) to the combustion engine. To ensure that no
fuel gas reaches the environment. The purge ?ow is controlled to avoid drivability problems caused by the
additional fuel gas.
36.20.1 Main operating situations
NO_PURGE
During this mode, CPS valve is closed
This mode is used
? when conditions to authorize evap control are not ful?lled (TCO, ...)
? while the lambda adaptation phase is ongoing
? in case of failures (CPS valve, ...)
? in case of OBD2 diagnosis request (catalyst check...)
? in case of evaporative system monitoring active
MIN_PURGE
The MIN_PURGE or open loop operation is used when the charcoal canister has to be purged even if its load
cannot be learned.
The conditions are:
? Vehicle is not equipped with A/F control
? A/F regulation component failures (lambda sensor...)
? Transient driving conditions. In this case, the purge ?ow is adjusted to have a maximum of 5% A/F ratio
deviation with a saturated canister.
NORMAL_PURGE / closed loop operation
The normal operation is used when the determination of the canister load is ?nished.
Purge ?ow is adjusted to have the maximum of the allowed A/F ratio deviation with a saturated canister.
The NORMAL_PURGE operation is proceeded in the following sequences:
RAMP_OPEN ?MAX_PURGE ?RAMP_CLOSE
RAMP_OPEN_FAST ?MAX_PURGE ?RAMP_CLOSE
RAMP_OPEN
At ?rst start of the NORMAL_PURGE the canister load is unknown. So, the purge valve is opened slowly using a
ramp (a high deviation of the lambda control shall be prevented). During this learning the fuel injection time is
corrected to avoid emission and drivability problems. The Canister Load is determined by the fuelpurge / ?ow
purge ratio.
The RAMP_OPEN operation is ?nished when :
? CL is learned and stable or
? The canister fuel ?ow (MFF_CP) is greater than a threshold or
? a time limit is reached.
RAMP_OPEN_FAST
When the canister load is considered as known, indicated by beeing within a certatin time interval since last
MAX_PURGE, the closed loop operation may start with a faster learning phase / ramp. This RAMP_OPEN_FAST
operation is ?nished when :
? The purge ?ow greater than a threshold
? The canister fuel ?ow (MFF_CP) is greater than a threshold.
MAX_PURGE
During MAX_PURGE operation the CPS valve is controlled by the canister load, thus a constant fuel ratio (fuel
from cps / total fuel) is applied and the valve opening is controlled to keep this constant fuel ratio by adjusting
the total purge ?ow.

EVAC, Evaporative system control (gen)
The target is to reach high ef?ciency purging. When the CL is low the purge valve opening will be increased
to ?nd the maximum limit of canister fuel ?ow.
RAMP_CLOSE
When the purge time is elapsed or the conditions for closed loop purge do not apply any longer, the purge
?ow is decreased via a ramp in RAMP_CLOSE operation. Although this state is no closed loop state, an injeciton
correction is done for the ramp, if this state is entered from one of the closed loop states (RAMP_OPEN/_FAST,
MAX_PURGE).

� Calibration Interfering Functions
Before starting the calibration work, it is absolute mandatory to have stable operation of
? Lambda-Control and Injection Pre-Control
? Intake Manifold Model
? Idle Speed Control
De?ciencies in the calibration quality of the above mentioned may block the calibration/operation or demand
a recalibration. Especially the Lambda Control and the Injection Pre-Control must be at a mature standard (
|Lambda Control output| <5% in stationary engine conditions).

Calibration label Calibration advice
IP_CPPWM_H CPS valve characteristic with high resolution
This table de?nes the valve opening (CPPWM) from two physical parameters:
purge ?ow set point (FLOW_COR_CPS) and
differential pressure (PRS_CPS).
The calibration values are gained from the ?ow bench measurements.
An excel ?le IP_CPPWM.XLS allows to prepare easily the ?ow bench results (?ow = f
[pressure, valve opening]) to ?ll up IP_CPPWM (valve opening = f [?ow, pressure]).
Breakpoints recommended values for FLOW_COR_CPS axe:
? The breakpoint values allow to avoid to spent
to much time at the beginning of Ramp Open
mode (small opening).
? The two ?rst breakpoints have to following rule:
The ?rst breakpoint will be zero (0 kg/h). The entire raw (valve opening) will be ?lled
up with = 0 % whatever the differential pressure PRS_DIF_CPS.
The second breakpoint will be a small purge ?ow value like 0.05 kg/h. The raw (valve
opening) will be ?lled out with the ?start to open? beginning of ?ow depending on the
differential pressure PRS_DIF_CPS.
IP_CPPWM_VB_ADD_1 Additive VB correction for CPPWM at frequency 1
This additive battery correction is applied to adapt the valve opening due to battery
voltage variation. The value is depending on the frequency selected.
IP_CPPWM_VB_ADD_2 Additive VB correction for CPPWM at frequency 2
IP_CPPWM_VB_FAC_1/2 Multiplicative VB correction for CPPWM at frequency 1 or 2.
This factor correction is applied to adapt the valve opening due to battery voltage
variation. The value is depending on the type of purge valve selected.
IP_CPPWM_VB_FAC_PRS_CPS_1/2 Multiplicative VB correction for CPPWM at frequency 1 or 2.
This factor corrects the "Additive VB correction for CPPWM at frq1" due to pressure CPS
changes.

These calibrations offer the possibility to use two different frequencies for the CPS
operation.
For a better understanding of the thresholds for a system with 2 possible frequencies the
following picture is helpful:

This is useful if the valve operates very linear at higher frequencies in for mid range PWMs,
but the opening behavior is better (i.e. more linear and repeatable) at lower frequencies.
Also it can be necessary to have a lower frequency for low PWMs to be able to perform the
electrical CPS diagnosis (this has to be clari?ed with the hardware / driver responsible).

Minimum and maximum CPPWM limits for each frequency which can be used for

are needed for SCG, OC and SCP diagnosis.

Calibration label Calibration advice
C_N_FRQ_HYS_CPS
C_CPPWM_FRQ_HYS_CPS
Hysteresis thresholds on engine speed (rpm) and CPPWM (% duty cycle) to shift CPS
frequency.
These parameters allow to get stable frequency switching.
C_CPPWM_FRQ_1,
C_CPPWM_FRQ_2
CPS output frequency 1 is used if no frequency switch is calibrated.
And if two frequencies are used on high N and high CPPWM and on low CPPWM and low
N.
CPS output frequency 2 is used at middle CPPWM and middle N.
These calibrations will de?ne the valve frequency value applied depending on engine
speed and purge valve opening. The selection of the frequency allows to control the purge
?ow with smaller deviation.

Calibration label Calibration advice
The time delay allows the lambda controller to be centered again.
These calibrations have to be re?ned depending on the standard driving cycle used. The
transient time duration will de?ne the values.
Method:
? engine bench or Chassis Dyno
? stable engine conditions
? canister purge function not active
? Choose 6 engine load points, give preference to the stable phases of the emission cycle.
? For each engine load measure the deviation
and variation (MIN and MAX) of the engine
speed (N) and mass air ?ow value (MAF)
(hom.) rsp. torque set point value
(TQI_SP_S) (lean).
? The dynamic window will be de?ne using
the formula [3 * (max-min) / 2]
? The division by 2 is the result of the
speci?cation description where the
dynamic window is de?ne as half window.
The time delay to set the stable condition information is tune on the emission cycle in
order to ?lter the lambda deviations during transients. The condition engine stable must be
active when lambda deviations (without purge) are elapsed.
C_CRLC_MAF_DYW_CP Filter constant for limited dynamics calculation on MAF
C_CRLC_N_DYW_CP Filter constant for limited dynamics calculation on engine speed
C_CRLC_LAM_DYW_CP Filter constant for limited dynamics calculation on lambda controller in non-normal purge
C_CRLC_LAMB_SP_S_DYW_CP Filter constant for limited dynamics calculation on lambda set point in strati?ed
C_CRLC_TQI_DYW_CP Filter constant for limited dynamics calculation on tqi_sp in strati?ed
C_MAF_CP_BOL_HYS Hysteresis for minimum mass air ?ow limit for activation of the RAMP_OPEN operation
(homogeneous)
C_TQI_CP_BOL_HYS Hysteresis for minimum torque limit for activation of the RAMP_OPEN operation (strati?ed)
LC_CP_DYW_CLC_ENA 1: calculation of dynamic window conditions
0: LV_CP_DYW always one
LC_LAM_DYW_CP_INI_DEAC 1: deactivate dynamic window on lambda control at deactivated
normal purge
C_NR_CBK_CPS The cylinder bank (due to 0-based indexing the ?rst cylinder bank is referenced with 0, the
second with 1) that shall be used within canister purge (e.g. MFF_SP, lambda controller
outputs, etc.). If more than one intake system (NC_CBK_IN_NR >1) is available, this variable
also de?nes the bank to which the CPS valve is connected.
IP_T_ST_AST_TCO_ST_CPS_MIN Set the IP to the minimum time for stable conditions after start.
� EVAC emission control variables (403H): Limited dynamic for CL calculation
The detection of the limited dynamics (LDC) are calculated based on engine speed, air mass ?ow and
combustion mode. If one of this differences to it?s moving mean value exceeds a calibrated threshold, a timer
is started until a calibrated time is reached. During the integral calculation LV_LDC_CLL_SUM_MAX_PURGE_
DEAC_CP = 1 which is used for inhibit the CL_MMV calculation for a robust canister load calculation.

IP_FLOW_CPS_HOM These values are the maximum canister purge ?ow in MIN_PURGE mode.
This ratio will limit the purge valve opening because no fuel compensation is done in this
mode.
?Lambda CP is the maximum lambda control deviation allowed to avoid drive ability
trouble (acceleration) when the lambda controller is not centered. This maximum deviation
is obtained with charcoal canister full loaded. The recommended value of ?Lambda CP is
about 5-6 % maximum.
From this maximum deviation the maximum purge ?ow can be evaluated for each engine
load :
?Canister Load = (Fuel Mass CP ) / Air Flow CP
?Air Flow CP = ( Air Flow cylinder * ?Lambda_control CP) /
( Kstochiometric * CLmax )
We know the maximum Canister Load ?2
and the usual Kstochiometric=14,57
? Air Flow CP = Air Flow cylinder * 0,00206
Nevertheless, we have to consider that for engine conditions like ?High Load? and charcoal
full loaded canister, the upstream/downstream differential pressure will be too low to
generate suf?cient purge ?ow then the lambda controller deviation will be also too low.
Method:
For each engine condition (N,MAF):
?Consider the maximum ?ow the purge valve can provide: IP_FLOW_CPS
? if IP_FLOW_CPS ?Air Flow 0
cylinder * 0.00206
then ?ll up IP_FLOW_CPS_HOM
with Air Flowcylinder * 0.00206
else ?ll up IP_FLOW_CPS_HOM
with IP_FLOW_CPS
endif
IP_RATIO_FUEL_MAX_CP_HOM
IP_RATIO_FUEL_MAX_CP_HOM_2
Maximum fuel ?ow ratio (fuel ?ow through the CPS/ total fuel ?ow) for homogeneous
stoichiometric operation.

This map allows to adapt the purge valve opening in order to purge with the maximum
ef?ciency when the CL is not at the maximum value. These calibrations are used in
RAMP_OPEN, RAMP_OPEN_FAST and MAX_PURGE modes.
These calibrations de?ne the maximum purge fuel quantity regarding the fuel engine
needs.
To avoid drive ability troubles the current ratio limitation between purge fuel and total
engine fuel is 25%.

? X% is the fuel purge/engine total fuel
ratio (given by engine bench )
? FLOW_CPS is de?ned by
IP_FLOW_MAX_CPS

with butane)

During transient mode the Lambda controller varies. The time duration of the lambda
controller is shorter than the one during the charcoal canister weight lost. This lambda
controller variation has not to be taken such as a loss of canister load.
? Different engine load in stable conditions
? Purge deactivated
? start with normal accelera-tion/deceleration
? Measure the time spent (T2) by the lambda
controller to reach a stable value {2}
Calculate the values (CL max *
recurrence) / T2 s {2}
The ?nal calibration value will be: {2} <
IP_CL_CRLC <{1a, 1c}
Usual approach:
Part and full load
IF for MAF_CYL ?90 kg/h the value calculated in {1a} >0.005 then ?ll up the mapping
table with 0,005
And for MAF_CYL <90 kg/h ?ll up the mapping table with 0.005 * value calculated in {1b}
Idle speed
At idle the average value of the lambda controller (TI_LAM_MMV) varies. Then this variation
generate another CL variation. For MAF_CYL breakpoint at idle and charcoal canister
empty re?ne the coef?cient ?lter to prevent these CL, CL_MMV oscillations.

load limits at the beginning of RAM_OPEN mode.

C_CL_MAX_CP The canister load is the fuel concentration of the A/F mixture that comes from the canister
through the CPS valve.
The mass of fuel (vapors) which is coming from
the canister depends on:
? the type of fuel used
? the system design (pressure drop...)
Charcoal canister loaded with butane
? The measurements should lead to the
theoretical value CL max = 0,7
Charcoal canister loaded with gasoline
? The fuel from the canister is in the vapor state
but the mass fuel ?ow is higher than the
butane. This mass is depending on the type
of fuel used and the in-use conditions. The
C_CL_MAX_CP value equal to 2 could
satis?ed most of applications. Check this
value during refueling in hot trip conditions
(high vapor generation that can lead to a
full and unstable canister load)

Calibration label Calibration advice
C_T_DLY_PU_CPS C_T_DLY_PU_1_CPS CPS interrupt time during PU.
Delay time after PU to close the valve.
When the engine management goes in trailling throttle (LV_PU) the injection time becomes
very small and near the minimum injection time. To prevent a big lambda deviation on
transition PL to PU the CPS valve is closed immediately during a time C_T_DLY_PU_CPS.
When this time is elapsed the function stay in MIN_PURGE during PU.
The time must allow to close the valve during the gas transfer between the CPS valve and
the oxygen sensor.
This time is de?ned by the duration of the engine gas transfer.
C_T_DLY_PUC_CP CPS interruption time after PUC
When the engine management goes in trailing throttle with fuel cut off (LV_PUC) the CPS
valve is closed immediately. After this phase, the canister purge will stay in NO_PURGE for
the time C_T_DLY_PUC_CP to prevent that the CL is in?uenced by lambda deviations that
are due to transitional effects from the PUC phase.
This time should be determined by forcing PUC phases with deactivated canister purge.
C_T_DLY_PUC_CP should be at least the time that is needed for lambda controller
stabilization after a PUC phase
C_T_LAM_LIM_CP Additional close loop deactivation duration due to LV_LAM_LIM activation.
Set, when the lambda controller sets its ?ags indicating "lambda control limitation reached"
C_FAC_LAM_CP_BOL
C_FAC_LAM_CP_TOL
Lambda control functional window.
Limit on FAC_LAM_CP value to start RAMP_OPEN
This window is additional to the control of the limitation ?ags from the lambda controller,
see above.
To prevent wrong canister load learning, the lambda control value will be checked all the
time in RAMP_OPEN. If C_FAC_LAM_CP_BOL <FAC_LAM_CP <C_FAC_LAM_CP_TOL,
RAMP_OPEN is disabled or stopped temporarily and MIN_PURGE is applied. This calibration
prevents the learning because the reference point FAC_LAM_0_CP is not centered at
RAMP_OPEN start.

If closed loop canister purge ("normal purge") is abandoned e.g. due to high engine
dynamic, the time counter T_DI_CP starts to count backwards from the corresponding
calibration values to 0. While it does not reach zero, a re-entering in the last closed loop
state is possible as soon as the conditions for closed loop canister purge are given again.
If the counter reaches 0, closed loop canister purge has to start with a new learning mode.

Calibration label Calibration advice
IP_FLOW_INC_CP During RAMP_OPEN, the valve is opening smoothly in order to control the lambda.
This calibration de?nes the slope of FLOW_CPS by incrementing directly FLOW_CTL_CPS
in homogeneous mode.
These increments will be checked during driving tests in hot conditions (charcoal canister
loaded)
IP_FLOW_INC_FAST_CP This calibration de?nes the slope of FLOW_CPS by incrementation of FLOW_CTL_CPS in
Ramp Open fast.
During RAMP_OPEN_FAST the CL is known so the purge valve can be opened faster than
the one used in RAMP_OPEN mode. In this case the slope of the purge valve opening will
be a compromise between opening speed and lambda control. This map is used for
homogeneous combustion.
IP_FLOW_FAC_CP Correction factor for the increment ramp of FLOW_CTL_CPS.
The canister load is not known in Ramp Open, therefore the suggestion is to calibrate it to 1
(neutral), except when idle causes problems; in that case it is possible to increase slightly
the ramp for low canister loads, so that in case of a maximum opening tolerance valve, the
valve is surely opened before going into Max Purge
IP_FLOW_FAC_LAM_DIF_MAXP_CP,
IP_FLOW_FAC_LAM_DIF_RO_CP,
IP_FLOW_FAC_LAM_DIF_ROF_CP
Correction of ?ow increment or decrement for FLOW_GRD_CPS by lambda deviation for
MAX_PURGE, RAMP_OPEN and RAMP_OPEN_FAST.
The idea is to slow down the ramps when the lambda controller is not centered ; but the
ramp must never be set to 0!
? The idea is to increase the ramps when the
lambda controller is well centered, as the basic
ramps are calibrated in the worst case
scenario =>very conservative calibration
? The second idea is to keep the lambda
controller under control when it is not centered ;
this even leads to have no ramp when the
lambda controller reaches its limits
IP_FLOW_DEC_CP Purge opening decrement value for FLOW_CPS during RAMP_CLOSE mode. The slope of
the closing prevents exhaust lambda variation.
This calibration de?nes the slope of FLOW_CPS.
Method:

empty loads
? Canister Load learned in RAMP_OPEN and
re?ned in MAX_PURGE.

C_FAC_FLOW_INI_RAMP_OPEN This value is used to initialize FLOW_CTL_CPS at the beginning of the RAMP_OPEN.
On entering RAMP_OPEN the ?ow setpoint is taken from the MIN_PURGE map, this factor
can be applied to decrease this value if an unwanted disturbance of the air/fuel ratio can be
observed at the start of the learning phase.
LC_FLOW_CL_FAC_RAMP_OPEN_INH Switch to inhibit CL correction of ?ow gradient in RAMP_OPEN (via IP_FLOW_FAC_CP).
As the accuracy of the CL value is much higher in RAMP_OPEN_FAST than in RAMP_OPEN,
the weighting of the FLOW_GRD_CPS by IP_FLOW_FAC_CP should be turned off in
RAMP_OPEN by setting the switch to 1, if the CL value has a high ?uctuation during this
state.
IP_FLOW_CPS_INC This map de?nes the ?ow increment during MAX_PURGE mode.
In MAX_PURGE, the closing of the valve must be the same as the one given by the ramp of
FLOW_CTL_CPS during RAMP_CLOSE.
The purge valve opening/closing is done by FLOW_CTL_CPS variations.
In case where the evaporative system design is not good enough (fuel tank purged : the
purge valve opening/closing has to be done slower. These calibrations allow to apply a 1st
order on the purge ?ow needed. The purge ?ow integrated will de?ne the purge valve
opening.
IP_FAC_AMP_CP Correction factor for ambient pressure.
The canister purge ?ow (Q PurgeMap ) values are de?ned at standard sea level barometric
pressure (P PurgeMap ) =1013 mb.
The factor correction by IP_FAC_AMP_CP allows to adapt the ?ow at the current barometric
pressure.
The variation of the canister purge ?ow is depending on the upstream pressure. This
variation follows the law:
Q Purge = Q PurgeMAP * [P barocurrent / P PurgeMAP ]
When the valve opening has to be
de?ned to get a needed canister purge ?ow the inverted law is used :
QPurgeMAP = Q Purge * [P PurgeMAP / P barocurrent]
IP_FAC_TIA_CP Correction factor for intake air temperature.
